key_risks: Market Competition: Intense competition from established players offering traditional IOLs and other vision correction technologies.
Regulatory Risks: Stringent regulatory requirements and potential delays in obtaining approvals.
Dependence on Key Products: Heavy reliance on the success of its Light Adjustable Lens (LAL) and Light Delivery Device (LDD).
Pricing and Reimbursement: Premium pricing may limit adoption in cost-sensitive markets, and reimbursement challenges could affect patient access.
Financial Performance: Significant operating losses and negative cash flows, with an accumulated deficit of $616.2 million as of September 30, 2024.
controversies: IPO and Public Offerings: Increased scrutiny on financial performance and governance following the 2021 IPO and subsequent public offerings.
social_issues: Patient Access: Potential limitations in patient access due to premium pricing and reimbursement challenges.
governance_issues: Corporate Governance: Increased scrutiny on governance practices following the IPO and public offerings.
